area.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a particular part of a country, town etc
area.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Only cheeses made in this area may be labelled ‘Roquefort’.
Crime rates are much higher in urban areas.
Many areas of Africa have suffered severe drought this year.
area.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a part of a house, office, garden etc that is used for a particular purpose
area.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Their apartment has a large kitchen area.
Come through into the dining area.
the reception area of the hotel
a storage area on the ground floor
area.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a particular subject, range of activities, or group of related subjects
area.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The course covers three main subject areas.
This study has clearly identified a major problem area for the National Health Service.
We’re funding research into new areas such as law enforcement technology.
reforms in the key areas of health and education
area.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: the amount of space that a flat surface or shape covers
area.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: a formula to calculate the area of a circle
area.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: a particular part of a country, town etc
area.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: ADJECTIVES/NOUN + area
a rural area
Schools in rural areas are often very small.
an urban area
90% of the English population live in urban areas.
a remote/isolated area
a remote area of northeast Afghanistan
the local area
He quickly made friends in the local area.
the surrounding area
The tourist office will have a map of the surrounding area.
outlying areas
The programme also includes plans to reforest outlying areas of the city.
a wooded area
The plane crashed into trees in a heavily wooded area.
a mountainous area
the mountainous areas of the Massif Central
a coastal area
The bird is found mainly in coastal areas.
a desert area
The hot, dry wind blows in from the desert areas of North Africa.
a residential area
They had a large house in a pleasant  residential area.
an industrial area
People living in industrial areas are exposed to these types of chemicals.
a built-up area
New development will not be allowed outside the existing built-up area.
a deprived area
He grew up in one of the toughest and most deprived areas of Glasgow.
an inner-city area
When will something be done to improve our inner-city areas?
a middle-class/working-class etc area
She was born in a working-class area of London.
a metropolitan area
major metropolitan areas such as Delhi, Bombay, and Calcutta
a conservation area
a new scheme to create a nature conservation area
a geographical area
The survey took place in three geographical areas.
move into/out of an area
She had just moved into the area and knew very few people.
Many young people are moving out of rural areas.
keep/stay away from an area
The police ordered people to stay away from the area.
be spread out over a wide area
The town is spread out over a wide area.
be scattered over a wide area
Parts of the plane were scattered over a wide area.
area.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 2: a part of a house, office, garden etc that is used for a particular purpose
area.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: The kitchen area is rather small.
The main living area was on the second floor.
Visitors should please report to the reception area.
There’s a temporary storage area where you can put those boxes.
We pulled off the highway into a picnic area for lunch.
There’s a nice play area for the kiddies.
The airport terminal is a no-smoking area.
Employers do not have to provide smoking areas.
area.translation[0].note_box[2].sections: a part of a town or country, or of the world
They live in a very wealthy area.
a large area of a country or the world
an area that is different from other areas around it in some way
We crossed two different time zones (=areas where there is a particular time compared to the rest of the world.)
one of the areas a city or town is officially divided into, or an area of a city where a particular group live or an activity happens
an area of a town where people live
There are lots of trees in our neighborhood.
an area outside the centre of a city, where people live
an area of a town or city where people of a particular nationality live
the French quarter of New Orleans
an area of a city that is in very bad condition, where many poor people live
He grew up in the slums of East London.
an area of a city where poor people of a particular race or class live
a black baby born in the ghetto
area.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a part of a city or country
area.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: What area of Bristol do you live in?
the New York metropolitan area (=New York city and the area around it)
area.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: the part of a shop or SHOPPING CENTRE where goods are sold
area.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: You enter its sales area straight off the street.
area.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: a particular subject, field of activity, or type of business
area.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: the areas of video games, electronic organizers and cellular phones
